body:
**PLEASE COORDINATE WITH SIG-SCHEDULING BEFORE WORKING ON THIS ISSUE.** We want to avoid the situation where two people accidentally start work on the same fix.

Main tracking issue: https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/issues/68951

If you contributed in phase 1, please give others a chance before claiming this issue. You can also help out by reviewing the phase 2 PRs.


The package `pkg/scheduler/algorithmprovider/defaults` contains `init()` code that makes several calls into `factory.RegisterFitPredicate` and similar functions. The code that registers all predicates should be moved into `pkg/scheduler/algorithm/predicates` along with the call to `factory.RegisterPredicateMetadataProducerFactory`. The above also applies to priorities, whose code belongs in `pkg/scheduler/algorithm/priorities`.


When this is done, the only `init()` code in the `defaults` package should be to `factory.RegisterAlgorithmProvider`.


Note: Algorithm providers are just sets of strings, so the `defaults` package doesn’t need to have any side effects beyond registering the two algorithm providers.


Other Note: I think `ApplyFeatureGates()` should be refactored away as part of https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/issues/68957.

/sig scheduling
/kind cleanup
/help
/good-first-issue

labels.name: good first issue

labels.name: help wanted

labels.description: Categorizes issue or PR as related to cleaning up code, process, or technical debt.
labels.name: kind/cleanup

labels.description: Categorizes an issue or PR as relevant to SIG Scheduling.
labels.name: sig/scheduling

title: [scheduler cleanup phase 2]: Move predicate and priority registration into their own packages
